name: 現代民主政治
goals: To enhance students' understanding of the basic concepts, theories and philosophies of social sciences such as politics and sociology.

To develop analytical methods for students to explore important issues in modern democratic society, to be able to explain the living conditions of human beings from different intellectual perspectives, and to understand the important issues facing Taiwanese society.
Increase students' awareness of Taiwan's political development and constitutional practice.

methodologies.note: At the beginning of each course, I will make a short introduction of the weekly given topic and raise the basic problems which are to be discussed in class.

Group discussion will be frequently used in class, so that students can learn from each other and complete tasks together. Students will be divided into groups according to the total amount of course students. Each group will have chance to present their ideas and creativity in class.
Students will learn to gather informations related to the course and to organize them by cooperation.
Films or clips will be adequately used as teaching materials. Through showing these materials, students will be asked to identify problems related to course subjects and their own observations.

grading.note: Group or individual assignments will be given in class.
Before doing a project, each group will present their group project design in the midterm week and collect opinions from the instructor and other students.
Each group will present the results of their project in the last two weeks of this course.
Students should regularly attend the class and participate in discussions.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
